metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2124 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer Over-read in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-athena - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-gtk3 - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-gui-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-motif - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-nox - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-runtime - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-tiny - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
xxd - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> in focal and earlier file to be patched is src/search.c instead of src/textobject.c. In focal and earlier, POC causes vim process to hang, and valgrind output does not include the out-of-bounds access.

criterions.comment: vim package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1').
